211$Depression$11/21/2013 4:30:44 PM$Reviewer: cb, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$5$I've suffered from depression since adolescence. 10 years of therapy have helped me cope but have tried multiple SSRIs, SNRIs, and Welbutrin throughout the years without any of them working well longterm. I've been on nortriptypine for over 5 years now and it is the best anti-depressant I've ever tried by far. I actually sleep for the first time in my life without waking up with panic attacks. Getting a good night's sleep alone has probably done wonders for my depression and anxiety. Sometimes I do feel a bit more tired when I do wake up but it's worth the good sleep. I do have some annoying side effects like increased heart rate, dry mouth, and flushing/red skin but they are worth the results I get. I haven't had a manic episode in years and am able to control and re-direct negative emotions much more effectively than I ever have. I really thank the one psychiatrist that suggest this medication to me, it changed my life.

429$Depression$8/8/2009 12:37:51 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$4$3$I was on this 20 years. It did help me function b/c I had depression and anxiety and insomnia. I was able to go to college and get a job but after many years on it I developed problems.  I now have gastroparesis and IBS. Most DR.s say this med helps the stomach but slows the intestines but since I've been off it 5 months all of my problesm with digestion  from swallowing all the way down to eliminating have improved. I had also developed reoccurring infections in my lymph nodes and exhaustion to the point of sleeping 17 hours a day. This too has improved but not gone away since being off the med. I'm guessing that my body has changed as I have aged making this not the right medicine for me anymore but it helped for many years. When I first started it it was a relief to me not to wake in the middle of the night in full blown panic attacks
column2: and to feel calmer. No other med has worked as well but I have to say goodbye b/c the infections in my lymph nodes and the exhaustion is too much to deal with. Some people say they felt foggy on it but I never did. I felt electrified without it
column3: and normal with it. It calmed me
column5: it really stopped full blown panic attacks. Dr.s say I shouldn't take it as it is dangerous but what antidepressant isn't? Am considering Lexapro now
column6: but after being drug free for 5 months I feel physically healthier and am wondering if the trade off is worth it. I am depressed. I have no....no desire to do anything. No drive. No hope. No pill is magic but what if it helps? No way to know but to try. As long as it isn't liver/heart/kidney/nervous system damaging I guess comming off would stop the negative effects. Plus I'm waiting to completely come back from the Cymbalta which nearly killed me.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$3$4$The primary reason of me taking this is for sleep deprivation with a secondary reason for depression.  Prior to this medication
column3: I was taking (3) 50mg tablets of amitriptyline at dinner as they take quite awhile to take effect. Amitriptyline definately works better than the Nortriptyline for sleep if taken at dinner time and not bedtime. I take Zanax 3 times a day also
column4: so I don't know if they cause anxiety.  I had to get off of the Amitriptyline because it makes it very difficult to get up at an early time like going to work.  The Amitriptyline started making me listless and depressed during the day also and then my Dr. put me on Nortriptyline as it makes it easier on getting up in the morning and having more energy during the day.  I would advise anybody taking Nortriptyline or Amitriptyline to read all the precautions here on WebMD as it gave me alot of information of all of the side effects along with other health problems you may have as Diabeties
column5: etc.that is listed and let your Dr. know about many other body issues you may have including Diabeties
column6: etc. I am more well of on Nortriptyline than Amitriptyline
column7: unless you just want to sleep night and day.  In closing
column8: I just urge you to read all of the information they provide here on WebMD. About 90% of the info. provided between the 2 medicines is the same.

476$Depression$2/16/2009 10:35:37 PM$Reviewer: Cameron, 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$5$I have manic-depression
column2: this is the first medication I have use to treat my condition
column3: for the first month I took a 50mg dose
column4: then changed to a 100mg at bedtime. The first few days I was using it I felt very tired in the afternoon
column5: But after about a week it really started to help lessen the symtoms of my condition. Less anxiety
column12: and I was do much better in school. When ever I exercise or reading I felt a pleasant tingling sensation
column13: a side effect but an enjoyable one. Exercising also increased the benefits of the medication. The side effects usually were not to bad
column14: dry mouth and strange taste in the morning
column17: and slightly high blood pressure. I never had any sexual problems
column18: but I have noticed a lowered sex drive. About 1 to 2 times a month at night after taking my dose I start to have what I would describe as ""closed-eye visuals""
column20: I also sometimes wake in the night and when I started to fall back asleep after a brief amount of time I would feel an unpleasant strong ""prickly"" felling in my brain
column22: which seemed overpowering as if I was still awake. Overall for me the benefits outweighted the side effects."

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been bi-polar for as long as I can remember and for the past 10 years have suffered through various stages of depression. I have taken about every medication available for these conditions. After being treated with ECT my doctor put me on Nortriptyline along with  Mirtazapine about two years ago. I am a little more irritable now but I no longer suffer from constant depression. My doctor started me on 25Mg and then increased the dose to 50Mg
column3: which I have been on for over a year.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I take 25mg tablet at bedtime.  overtime I have had to take zopiclone for sleep

column1: 483$Depression$1/21/2009 2:46:52 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver) $1$1$4$My mother was taking this medicine for her depression. She was on it for a little over a year. She committed suicide while on this medication...ironically...this medication is what she used for the suicide...she took an intentional overdose. I suppose that everyone is different and responds different to medication but I have read some other's comments about extreme mood changes in their loved ones. Then there are other reports stating everything is working great. I have always found it strange that the very medications they use to treat depression can actually make it worse. Most antidepressants now actually have warnings about causing a deeper level of depression and actually causing thoughts of suicide in some people...even in those who have never considered suicide previously. Doesn't make sense to me...but I am not a doctor nor a chemist who make these drugs. Hooray to those of you that find relief in this medicine and I have deep sympathies for those who have seen themselves or their loved ones go further downhill. It is rough to witness someone's pain and suffering like that.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$4$After trying 8 different SSRI's I stopped taking all of them. For a couple of week's I felt good. Then I rebounded back with Depresion and Anxiety. Not that any of the other drugs helped much. Trazadone did for awhile. then the side effects kicked in. When I stopped the drugs
column3: I started having brain freezes. little shocks evry time I moved my eyes or head. Sometimes 40-50 a minute. They lasted for about 6 weeks. Tey didn't stop until my Dr. (a new Dr.) had me start Nortriptyline. He started me on 10mgs
